newsitem.title: UK: UK wool sale - Prices steady, demand up 10 pct.
newsitem.headline: UK wool sale - Prices steady, demand up 10 pct.

text.p: The third Bradford sale of the season saw strong competition resulting in an 89 percent clearance, up 10 percent since the last Bradford sale on July 24, brokers reported on Thursday.
"It does look like business is beginning to pick up," one market source said.
Most prices remained steady to just easier with the price indicator ending unchanged at 106 pence per kg.
The total offering of 2,639.527 kg wool included a spot offering of 3,850 kg carried over from last season (1995) which was sold in its entirety, brokers said.
The healthy demand for forward wools continued with almost 97 percent of the 767,779 kg offering finding sale, they said.
